heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day was 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: When lightning struck on 13 May 2025, its position was recorded at just 4.97 miles away, the closest on record.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 07 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (187°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 7.0°C) and outside temperature (down 6.1°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 8961 lux) and cloud levels (up 748 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 8449 lux) and cloud levels (up 666 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 747.5m lower than yesterday, 146.8m lower than the past week, 665.8m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 928m to 5160m and averaged 1786.8m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, pleasant humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and some sunny spells will occur. Changeable conditions.
